phrases.phrase: Login attempt log
User log
Approves someone else's user name change
Approves your user name change
Rejects your user name change
Daily clean up (User essentials)
User name change approved
User name change rejected
Custom upgrade amount maximum
Custom upgrade amount minimum
Display mini-avatars
Send edited in mentions
Allow re-use of old user names
User name change custom title duration
Display administrator user name changes in previous user name list
Maximum user name changes
Maximum message count for user name changes
Moderate user name changes
Notify moderators of user name changes
User name change interval
Display previous user name list to
Last edit message alignment
User log length
Post Edit History
Edit Post Minimum Characters
Prevent administrators changing the primary group
Separate thread title and post edit time limits
Send user name change notifications on administrator edit by default
Private by default for user name change on administrator edit
Wrap conversation area pages in the account wrapper
User name not match regular expression
Wrap watched content pages in the account wrapper

The maximum value to accept for a custom upgrade amount.

This maximum is not arbitrary, some payment providers error on values over 999.99
The minimum value to accept for a custom upgrade amount
Display mini-avatars next to a user mention or user group mention. Adds 1 extra query per page load for content which supports mini-avatars.

If enabled, send edited in mentions for supported content. Requires mention tracking to be re-build for new installs.
Run: 
php cmd.php xf-rebuild:sv-mentions
, and once it completes this setting will be enabled.
If this setting is enabled for new installs without running the above, unexpected duplicate alerts will be sent when editing content with a quote or mention.

If enabled, users will be able to register and change their user name to a user name previously used by another member. Allowing user name re-use can cause confusion, particularly for older quoted messages. This restriction does not apply to administrator user creation and edits.

After a user name change, users will receive a custom title displaying their previous user name for this many days. You may edit the phrase 'sv_ue_username_change_user_title' to customize the title. Use 0 to disable.
If enabled, user name changes applied by administrators will be shown in the list of previous user names for a user.
The maximum number of times a user can change their user name. Use 0 to disable.
The maximum number of messages a user may have before being unable to change their user name. If set, this option overrides the maximum user name changes option. Use 0 to disable.
If enabled, all user name changes must be approved by moderators before being applied.
If enabled, moderators will be notified when a user name change takes place.

Users will not be able to submit more than the maximum number of user name changes within this many days. For example, a maximum of 1 change every 7 days. To cause the maximum to be permanent, use 0 to disable.
This option controls who will be able to view a user's previous user names.
Controls which side of a post the last edit message is aligned to.
The number of days that user log records will be kept for. Use 0 to keep the records permanently.

Do you want to keep track of message content with each post edit?
Selecting "Yes" will save a copy of each post prior to it being edited, thus allowing you to view the pre-edited version via the Last edited by link.
This will slightly increase the amount of disk space used.

Minimum number of characters (including BB Code) that need to be added to or removed from the message, or changed within words (line swaps), in order to trigger the logging of the edit post action. This allows for the correction of spelling mistakes or grammatical errors without considering the post as edited. Zero (0) means the action will always be logged (after taking the Grace Period permission into consideration).
Depending on the permissions scheme, changing the primary user group breaks accounts and should not be done.

If enabled, users will be allowed to edit thread titles even after the post edit time limit has expired, provided the thread title time limit has not expired.
This can result in being able to edit some aspects of a thread but not the title!
If enabled, notifications will be sent when an administrator manually edits a member's user name by default. Administrators can override this setting when editing a user.
If enabled, user name changes triggered by an admin will be private by default. Administrators can override this setting when editing a user.
If enabled, the conversation area will be wrapped in the account wrapper.
This requires user names to not match the given regular expression. Note: use a full expression, including delimiters and switches.
If enabled, watched content pages will be wrapped in the account wrapper.
User Essentials
Options that control the behavior of user name changes, user logging, and more.
[UserEss] Create polls
[UserEss] Time limit on editing own thread title (minutes)
[UserEss] Lock / unlock own thread
[UserEss] Post replies in other's threads
[UserEss] Ban users from replying to own thread
[UserEss] Delete posts in own thread
[UserEss] Edit posts in own thread
[UserEss] Change own user name
[UserEss] Approve / reject user name changes
[UserEss] Edit user name change privacy
[UserEss] Hide online status
[UserEss] Manage tags on any profile
[UserEss] Manage tags on own profile
Administrators and moderators only
Administrators, moderators, and the user only

Your user name has been changed to {name}. Note: {note}

Your request to change your user name to {name} has been rejected. Note: {note}

Previous names
Private user name change
If selected, this user name change will only be visible to staff and the user.
Profile tags
Quantity
The maximum number of purchases that can be made for this upgrade. Use 0 to disable.
Rebuild content mentions
Recurring user upgrades cannot have a quantity.

This is the name that will be shown with your messages. You may use any name you wish.

This note will be included in the notification sent to users.

The time limit to edit this thread title ({minutes} minutes) has expired.
To name
Total changes

If enabled, the thread starter will be able to unlock this thread even if it was locked by a moderator.
User log

User name change

User name changed on {board_title}
{username}, your request to change your user name on {board} to {toName} has been rejected.
User name change rejected on {board_title}
User name change for {name}
Pending change to {newName}
Provide a note to assist moderators with approving your user name change.
The user was merged into this user.
Formerly '{oldName}'
This is the name that is shown with your messages. You may use any name you wish. Your former user name will still be displayed in any prior quoted messages.
View conversations
You can change your user name {remaining} more time(s).
You can change your user name {remaining} more time(s) before {periodEnd}.
You can change your user name {max} time(s).
You can change your user name {max} time(s) every {period} days.
You can not change your user name after you post more than {max} messages.
You can not change your user name again until {periodEnd}.
You currently have a user name change pending approval.
You have not given any content any likes yet.
Your user name cannot be changed while your account does not have a password.
Your user name change must be approved by a moderator.
